imu_listener.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 import rospy
4 from std_msgs.msg import Int16
5 from sensor_msgs.msg import Imu
6 
7 import numpy as np
8 
9 
10 class ImuListener():
11 
12  def __init__(self, num_imus, acc_thresh=0.3):
13  """
14  ImuListener class for registering when IMUs are
15  activated; that is, the IMU is moved enough.
16 
17  Arguments
18  ----------
19  `num_imus`: `int`
20  Amount of IMUs on the robot
21 
22  `acc_thresh`: `float`
23  The default threshold used to determine the
24  minimal difference between two consecutive
25  IMU readings to constitute an 'activated' IMU.
26 
27  Returns
28  ----------
29  returns: None
30  """
31 
32  self.prev_imu_matrix = np.full((num_imus, 3), np.nan)
33  self.acc_thresh = acc_thresh
34  rospy.init_node('skin_calibration', anonymous=True)
35  self.imu_mvmt_pub = rospy.Publisher('/imu_activated', Int16, queue_size=1)
36  self.imu_num_msg = Int16()
37  # create subscribers for num_imus topics
38  for i in range(num_imus):
39  rospy.Subscriber('imu_data{}'.format(i), Imu, self.imu_callback)
40 
41  rospy.spin()
42 
43  def imu_callback(self, data):
44  """
45  A ROS callback for checking IMU data and
46  publishing a message if a certain IMU is
47  activated.
48 
49  Arguments
50  ----------
51  `data`: `Imu`
52  `Imu` message from the IMU
53 
54  Returns
55  ----------
56  returns: None
57  """
58  imu_num = int(data.header.frame_id[-1])
59  is_nan = np.isnan(self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num])
60  # if the measurements are unitialized, initialize them
61  if np.all(is_nan):
62  self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num, 0] = data.linear_acceleration.x
63  self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num, 1] = data.linear_acceleration.y
64  self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num, 2] = data.linear_acceleration.z
65  else:
66  # data from previous callback was already initialized
67  prev_imu_acc = self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num]
68  x_diff = np.abs(prev_imu_acc[0] - data.linear_acceleration.x)
69  y_diff = np.abs(prev_imu_acc[1] - data.linear_acceleration.y)
70  z_diff = np.abs(prev_imu_acc[2] - data.linear_acceleration.z)
71  total_diff = np.linalg.norm(np.array([x_diff, y_diff, z_diff]))
72  if total_diff > self.acc_thresh:
73  print('*************DIFF***************')
74  print(data.header.frame_id)
75  print('NEW DATA')
76  print('x: {}'.format(data.linear_acceleration.x))
77  print('y: {}'.format(data.linear_acceleration.y))
78  print('z: {}'.format(data.linear_acceleration.z))
79  print('OLD DATA')
80  print('x: {}'.format(self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num, 0]))
81  print('y: {}'.format(self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num, 1]))
82  print('z: {}'.format(self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num, 2]))
83  print('')
84  # publish the imu message if the acceleration
85  # is above a certain threshold.
86  self.imu_mvmt_pub.publish(Int16(imu_num))
87  self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num, 0] = data.linear_acceleration.x
88  self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num, 1] = data.linear_acceleration.y
89  self.prev_imu_matrix[imu_num, 2] = data.linear_acceleration.z
90 
91 
92 if __name__ == '__main__':
93  # create the IMU listener, and spin.
94  imu_listener = ImuListener(num_imus=7)
